content.title: Financial Assistance To Gad-Hanjis
content.details: In the 'Financial Assistance to Gad-Hanjis', financial assistance for the purchase of Nylon Twine is provided to the Licensed Fisherman (Gad-Hanjis) by the Social Welfare Department. The beneficiary shall approach the concerned District Social Welfare Officer (DSWO) for submission of the application. This is a 100% State Sponsored Scheme, and only the permanent residents of the state of Jammu & Kashmir can apply for this scheme.
benefits: License holders having paid fee of ₹ 50/-: ₹ 500/-
License holders having paid fee of ₹ 40/-: ₹ 400/-
License holders having paid fee of ₹ 30/-: ₹ 300/-
License holders having paid fee of ₹ 20/-: ₹ 200/-
eligibility: The applicant should be a citizen of India.
The applicant should be a Gad-Hanji (Fisherman) licensed by the Fisheries Department consecutively for the last 3 years.
The annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹ 3,600/-.
The applicant should not have received assistance under this scheme during the last 2 years.
documents_required: Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of the State/UT of Jammu & Kashmir
Fisherman License by the Fisheries Department, Govt. of Jammu & Kashmir
Details of the Bank Account (Bank Name, Branch Name, Address, IFSC, etc)
Income Certificate indicating the monthly income of the family from all sources
Any other document required by the District Social Welfare Office

faqs.question: What Types Of Benefits Are Provided In This Scheme?
faqs.answer: In this scheme, financial assistance for the purchase of Twine is provided to the Licensed Fisherman (Gad-Hanjis).

faqs.question: What Amount Of Financial Assistance Shall Be Paid To A Licensed Fisherman Who Has Paid A Fee Of ₹ 50/-?
faqs.answer: ₹ 500/- shall be paid to a Licensed Fisherman who has paid a fee of ₹ 50/-.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance That One Can Receive Through This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The maximum amount of financial assistance that one can receive through this scheme is ₹500/-.

faqs.question: Is The Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate Of The State Of Jammu & Kashmir, A Mandatory Document For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of the State of Jammu & Kashmir is a mandatory document for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is This A State Funded Or A Centrally Funded Scheme?
faqs.answer: This is a 100% State Funded scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No, the entire application process is entirely free of cost.

faqs.question: Can Applicants From The Neighboring States Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only the citizens who are permanent residents of the state of Jammu & Kashmir are eligible to apply.
